During their travels abroad, they met one Ali Bayendor, a Persian, and eventually Miss Sykes married him and went to live at Abadan. When my aunt died, she left me as trustee for her estate and I have to pay £200 a year to Mrs. Bayendor for life. physicalDescription.extent: Foliation: the foliation sequence (used for referencing) commences at the front cover with 1, and terminates at the inside back cover with 10; these numbers are written in pencil, are circled, and are located in the top right corner of the recto side of each folio.

mods.abstract: This file consists of correspondence between the India, Home, and Foreign Offices regarding the repatriation of a widow and her child. The correspondence concerns the nationality of the British-born widow who had married a Persian Admiral, citing the Persian Marriage and Nationality Law of 1929, and the consequent visa and travel arrangements needed for her repatriation. Finally, the file includes a letter from the British-based family of the widow's former employer offering allowance provision if desired.
